subject: Re: [junit] Install problem "Class not found "junit.samples.AllTests"
msgSnippet: ... Yes. JUnit is not installed at C: jUnit; it is at C: jUnit junit3.8.1. Put this second path on your CLASSPATH instead of C: jUnit. -- J. B. Rainsberger,
messageBody:
Adrian Rutter wrote:

> I've extracted the jUnit download into C:\JUnit. I've set the CLASSPATH
> "C:\jUnit\junit3.8.1\junit.jar;C:\jUnit"
>
> On the console I've gone to this dir "C:\jUnit\junit3.8.1" and entered this
>
> java junit.awtui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
>
> I receive this error:
>
> "Bootstrap: infestation error: couldn't get install directory"
>
> The TestRunner appears but an error msg is shown "Class not found
> "junit.samples.AllTests"
>
> Can you help?

Yes. JUnit is not installed at C:\jUnit; it is at C:\jUnit\junit3.8.1.
Put this second path on your CLASSPATH instead of C:\jUnit.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
